subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Vision vs. Reality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Vision vs. Reality.

hook.text: Every founder has a vision. The problem is, the vision is almost always wrong in important ways.

buildup.text: Founders fall in love with their original idea. They see criticism as a threat, not a signal.

discovery.text: Lean startup says keep the vision but hold the strategy loosely. Adapt the path, not the destination.

twist.text: YouTube started as a video dating site. The vision of 'video for everyone' survived; the strategy didn't.

climax.text: The best founders separate identity from strategy. They pivot without losing their purpose.

punchline.text: A good vision bends. A rigid vision breaks.

quiz.question: What does lean startup recommend founders do with their vision and strategy?
options: Abandon both and follow customer demand entirely
Keep the vision steady but hold the strategy loosely and adapt
Lock in the strategy early and execute without deviation
